chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony Donald Matson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Anthony Donald Matson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Anthony Donald Matson was found guilty of 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).
  • Anthony Donald Matson was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
AMENDED 02-14-2017:  Court modifies probation to order defendant to pay $100.00 commencing 04-01-2017 and the first of each month thereafter to first be applied to restitution, then costs on count 1.  Upon payment in full, payments to be applied to count 5.
Consecutive to: Count 5

miscConds.notes:
To be paid according to schedule as set forth by Probation & Parole.
AMENDED 02-14-2017:  Court modifies probation to order defendant to pay $100.00 commencing 04-01-2017 and the first of each month thereafter to first be applied to restitution, then costs on count 1.  Upon payment in full, payments to be applied to count 5.

Pay County Appointed Attorney Fees of $742.00 with credit for $100.00 on deposit.
Court waives costs and surcharges based upon ability to pay.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

timeConds.notes:
Serve 6 months in the Pepin County Jail with work release and credit for 134 days served.
Consecutive to: Count 5

supervisions.notes: Serve 6 months in the Pepin County Jail with credit for 135 days served.
Operating privileges revoked for a period of 24 months with credit for any administrative suspension.

Operator's license IID effective date of application.
Vehicle IID effective 45 days from sentence date.
Submit to and comply with an alcohol assessment by the approved public treatment facility and comply with the development of a driver safety plan.

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #5

Court advises defendant of charge of OWI 5th offense, dismiss  repeater allegation/max penalties; Advised of count 1 reckless endanger as repeater/max penalties.  Defendant pleads no contest to Count 1 & 5. PLQ/WOR form filed with the court and reviewed with defendant. Court advises defendant of his constitutional rights; finds defendant's waiver of his constitutional rights and plea done knowingly & voluntarily, accepts pleas and finds defendant guilty Count 5 and Count 1.  On OWI 5th, sentence to 6 months in the Pepin County Jail with credit for 135 days served; revoke operating privileges for 24 mos; 12 mos. IID Order eff. 45 days from today; AA/DSP; Fine/costs $1794.00.  Count 1 withhold sentence and place on 4 years probation consecutive to sentence on Count 5 with conditions; advised of appeal rights, felony conviction prohibitions; Dismiss Counts 2, 3, 4 of 15CF43, 15TR462, 463, 464, 465 and 16CF09.
Count 5 - Repeater allegation dismissed.

Jury trial on August 29, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Jury Trial Scheduling Order:
1.  Trial of this matter is set for jury trial on August 29 & 30, 2016 at 9:00 a.m.  Time allowed for trial is two days.
2.  The District Attorney will send the Defense Atty their settlement offer prior to the FPT.
3.  The Defense Atty shall review the DA's settlement offer with his/her client prior to the FPT.
4.  A FPT is set for August 1, 2016 at 4:00 p.m.
5.  The Defense Atty, the Defendant, and the District Atty shall all personally appear at the FPT.
Failure of the Defendant to appear personally at the FPT shall result in the cancellation of the trial date and a warrant being issued for the defendant's arrest.
6.  All motions shall be filed in writing and no later than April 29, 2016. ....
If a motion is filed, the filing attorney shall contact the Court and obtain a pretrial motion hearing date.
Notices of alibi and responses shall follow the time limits and other requirements of Sec. 971.23(8) Wis. Stats.
7.  If either side intends to offer expert testimony..., such party shall give written notice to the court and opposing counsel no later than April 29, 2016, of the name, address and qualifications of the expert, the opinions which will be solicited from such expert and the basis for those opinions. .... 
For complete Order see file.

Motion hearing on March 29, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Status conference at 03-21-2016 01:30 pm

Defendant Anthony Donald Matson in court with attorney Francis Xavier Rivard.  Defendant Anthony Donald Matson in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court confirms counsel received the Amended Information; advises defendant of charges/maximum penalties and constitutional rights.  New complaint filed in 16CF09, advised of charge/max. penalties.  Court advises defendant of constitutional rights.  NGP entered on all charges.  Atty Rivard requests to address bond, requests lower cash bond.  State notes reason why cash bond imposed and only good way for public to remain safe is he remain locked up.  Court orders bond remain as previously set.  Referred to scheduling clerk.

Defendant Anthony Donald Matson in court, in custody.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard appeared by phone means for Defendant Anthony Donald Matson. Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court explains why defendant in custody.  State requests $5000 cash bond.  Atty Rivard requests Sign. Bond.  Court sets $2000 cash bond with additional conditions:  No possession or consumption of alcohol; No entrance into bars or taverns; No operation of a motor vehicle without valid license or insurance; No other violations of law.

Defendant Anthony Donald Matson not in court.   Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard appeared by phone means.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Warrant requested by State and authorized by the Court.

Defendant Anthony Donald Matson in court with attorney Allan L Morgan.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court was informally informed defendant lost his job.  Atty Morgan informs court defendant qualifies for State Public Defender.  Atty Morgan consents to stay on for hrg. today and will then be discharged as county appointed attorney.  Deputy Peter Pillman Sworn & testifies.  Closing arguments by defense counsel.  Court finds probable cause a felony was committed and bind defendant over for trial.  Instruct the DA to file the Information.  Discharge Atty Morgan of his duties.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Case recalled. Defendant now appears with SPD Patrick Waters.  Defendant qualifies as long as he's in custody.  Atty Waters requests to review bond.  Any objection to post cash bond or be on monitor release?  He lives with his step-mother with no criminal record and agree to alcohol monitor.  Court orders cash bond or by alcohol monitor like VICAP.  Additional conditions:  No drinking, no bars, no operation of vehicle, no other violations of law.  Counsel requests if can make it no operation MV without valid license?  Court approves and orders no operation of motor vehicle without license or insurance.  Position on P.H.?  Waive time limits.  If he can't post, likely to ask for P.H.  New date given 10-06-2015 @ 2:30 p.m. cont'd INIT.  Bond so modified.  Court will contact guy re: alcohol monitoring to contact him at the jail.

Defendant Anthony Donald Matson in court, in custody.  Adam Sticht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court confirms defendant received copy of criminal complaint, advises of charges/max. penalties, repeater penalties and rights, right to preliminary hearing.  State requests $2000 cash bond based on criminal history, 2003 OWI 1st EC Co.; 2005 Meth EC Co.; 2007 OWI 2nd Brown Co.; 2008 OWI 3rd Winnebago Co.; 2009 OAR Winnebago Co.; 2012 THC 2nd Winnebago Co.; 20012 OWI 4th Winnebago Co.; 2012 Hit & Run Winnebago Co.; resides outside of the county; seriousness of the charges; no one was hurt but owner's grandson was in the room that was hit; he did not have permission to drive the truck he was driving that night.  Court informs he would likely increase that request with concern of flight as well as your criminal record, you face substantial charges, prior record from substantial use of a MV while under the influence of an intoxicant, drug charges, this involves dangerous use of vehicle, set higher bond we can always review it, set bond at $5000 cash with conditions: No possession or consumption of alcohol, no entrance into bars or taverns, no operation motor vehicle, no other violations of law.  SPD here today, speak with him and to get a new date.
